00020 /*****************************************************************************
00021 
00022   sc_concatref.h -- Concatenation support.
00023  
00024   Original Author: Andy Goodrich, Forte Design, Inc.
00025   
00026  *****************************************************************************/
00027 
00028 /*****************************************************************************
00029 
00030   MODIFICATION LOG - modifiers, enter your name, affiliation, date and
00031   changes you are making here.
00032 
00033       Name, Affiliation, Date:
00034   Description of Modification:
00035 
00036   Andy Goodrich, Forte Design Systems, 17 Nov 2002
00037   Creation of sc_concatref class by merging the capabilities of 
00038   sc_int_concref, sc_int_concref, sc_uint_concref, sc_uint_concref, 
00039   and implementing the capabilities of sc_signed_concref, sc_signed_concref, 
00040   sc_unsigned_concref, and sc_unsigned_concref. The resultant class allows 
00041   mixed mode concatenations on the left and right sides of an assignment.
00042 
00043  *****************************************************************************/
00044 
00045 // $Log: sc_concatref.h,v $
00046 // Revision 1.6  2011/08/24 22:05:48  acg
00047 //  Torsten Maehne: initialization changes to remove warnings.
00048 //
00049 // Revision 1.5  2009/11/17 19:58:15  acg
00050 //  Andy Goodrich: fix of shift rhs possibilities to include "int".
00051 //
00052 // Revision 1.4  2009/02/28 00:26:29  acg
00053 //  Andy Goodrich: bug fixes.
00054 //
00055 // Revision 1.3  2008/04/29 20:23:55  acg
00056 //  Andy Goodrich: fixed the code that assigns the value of a string to
00057 //  an sc_concatref instance.
00058 //
00059 // Revision 1.2  2008/02/14 20:57:26  acg
00060 //  Andy Goodrich: added casts to ~0 instances to keep MSVC compiler happy.
00061 //
00062 // Revision 1.1.1.1  2006/12/15 20:20:05  acg
00063 // SystemC 2.3
00064 //
00065 // Revision 1.4  2006/10/23 19:36:59  acg
00066 //  Andy Goodrich: changed casts for operations on concatenation values to
00067 //  mirror those of sc_unsigned. For instance, an sc_unsigned minus a value
00068 //  returns an sc_signed result, whereas an sc_concatref minus a value was
00069 //  returning an sc_unsigned result. Now both sc_unsigned and sc_concatref
00070 //  minus a value return an sc_signed result.
00071 //
00072 // Revision 1.3  2006/01/13 18:54:01  acg
00073 // Andy Goodrich: added $Log command so that CVS comments are reproduced in
00074 // the source.
00075 //

00108 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00109 //  CLASS TEMPLATE : sc_concatref
00110 //
00111 //  Proxy class for sized bit concatenation.
00112 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00113 
00114 class SC_API sc_concatref : public sc_generic_base<sc_concatref>, public sc_value_base
00115 {
00116 public:
00117     friend class sc_core::sc_vpool<sc_concatref>;
00118 
00119     inline void initialize( 
00120         sc_value_base& left, sc_value_base& right )
00121         {    
00122             bool left_xz;   // True if x's and/or z's found in left.
00123             bool right_xz;  // True if x's and/or z's found in right.
00124             
00125             m_left_p = (sc_value_base*)&left;
00126             m_right_p = (sc_value_base*)&right;
00127             m_len_r = right.concat_length(&right_xz);
00128             m_len = left.concat_length(&left_xz) + m_len_r;
00129             m_flags = ( left_xz || right_xz ) ? cf_xz_present : cf_none;
00130         }
00131 
00132 
00133     inline void initialize( 
00134         const sc_value_base& left, const sc_value_base& right )
00135         {    
00136             bool left_xz;   // True if x's and/or z's found in left.
00137             bool right_xz;  // True if x's and/or z's found in right.
00138 
00139             m_left_p = (sc_value_base*)&left;
00140             m_right_p = (sc_value_base*)&right;
00141             m_len_r = right.concat_length(&right_xz);
00142             m_len = left.concat_length(&left_xz) + m_len_r;
00143             m_flags = ( left_xz || right_xz ) ? cf_xz_present : cf_none;
00144         }
00145 
00146     // destructor
00147 
00148     virtual ~sc_concatref()
00149     {}
00150 
00151 
00152     // capacity
00153 
00154     unsigned int length() const
00155         { return m_len; }
00156 
00157 #ifdef SC_DT_DEPRECATED
00158     int bitwidth() const
00159         { return length(); }
00160 #endif
00161 
00162     // concatenation
00163 
00164     virtual int concat_length( bool* xz_present_p ) const
00165     { 
00166         if ( xz_present_p ) 
00167             *xz_present_p = m_flags & cf_xz_present ? true : false;
00168         return m_len; 
00169     }
00170 
00171     virtual void concat_clear_data( bool to_ones )
00172     { 
00173         m_left_p->concat_clear_data(to_ones); 
00174         m_right_p->concat_clear_data(to_ones); 
00175     }
00176 
00177     virtual bool concat_get_ctrl( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const
00178     {
00179         bool rnz = m_right_p->concat_get_ctrl( dst_p, low_i );
00180         bool lnz = m_left_p->concat_get_ctrl( dst_p, low_i+m_len_r );
00181         return rnz || lnz;
00182     }
00183 
00184     virtual bool concat_get_data( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const
00185     {
00186         bool rnz = m_right_p->concat_get_data( dst_p, low_i );
00187         bool lnz = m_left_p->concat_get_data( dst_p, low_i+m_len_r );
00188         return rnz || lnz;
00189     }
00190 
00191     virtual uint64 concat_get_uint64() const
00192     {
00193         if ( m_len_r >= 64 )
00194             return m_right_p->concat_get_uint64();
00195         else
00196         {
00197             return (m_left_p->concat_get_uint64() << m_len_r) | 
00198                 m_right_p->concat_get_uint64();
00199         }
00200     }
00201 
00202     virtual void concat_set( int64 src, int low_i ) 
00203     { 
00204         m_right_p->concat_set( src, low_i );
00205         m_left_p->concat_set( src, low_i+m_len_r);
00206     }
00207 
00208     virtual void concat_set( const sc_signed& src, int low_i ) 
00209     {
00210         m_right_p->concat_set( src, low_i );
00211         m_left_p->concat_set( src, low_i+m_len_r);
00212     }
00213 
00214     virtual void concat_set( const sc_unsigned& src, int low_i ) 
00215     { 
00216         m_right_p->concat_set( src, low_i );
00217         m_left_p->concat_set( src, low_i+m_len_r);
00218     }
00219 
00220     virtual void concat_set( uint64 src, int low_i )
00221     { 
00222         m_right_p->concat_set( src, low_i );
00223         m_left_p->concat_set( src, low_i+m_len_r);
00224     }
00225 
00226 
00227     // explicit conversions
00228 
00229     uint64 to_uint64() const 
00230         {
00231             uint64 mask;
00232             uint64 result;
00233 
00234             result = m_right_p->concat_get_uint64();
00235             if ( m_len_r < 64 )
00236             {
00237                 mask = (uint64)~0;
00238                 result = (m_left_p->concat_get_uint64() << m_len_r) | 
00239                             (result & ~(mask << m_len_r));
00240             }
00241             if ( m_len < 64 )
00242             {
00243                 mask = (uint64)~0;
00244                 result = result & ~(mask << m_len);
00245             }
00246             return result;
00247         }
00248 
00249     const sc_unsigned& value() const
00250         {
00251             bool           left_non_zero;
00252             sc_unsigned*   result_p = sc_unsigned::m_pool.allocate();
00253             bool           right_non_zero;
00254 
00255             result_p->nbits = result_p->num_bits(m_len);
00256             result_p->ndigits = DIV_CEIL(result_p->nbits);
00257             result_p->digit = (sc_digit*)sc_core::sc_temp_heap.allocate( 
00258                 sizeof(sc_digit)*result_p->ndigits );
00259 #if defined(_MSC_VER)
00260             // workaround spurious initialisation issue on MS Visual C++
00261             memset( result_p->digit, 0, sizeof(sc_digit)*result_p->ndigits );
00262 #else
00263             result_p->digit[result_p->ndigits-1] = 0;
00264 #endif
00265             right_non_zero = m_right_p->concat_get_data( result_p->digit, 0 );
00266             left_non_zero = m_left_p->concat_get_data(result_p->digit, m_len_r); 
00267             if ( left_non_zero || right_non_zero ) 
00268                 result_p->sgn = SC_POS;
00269             else
00270                 result_p->sgn = SC_ZERO;
00271             return *result_p;
00272         }
00273 
00274     int64 to_int64() const
00275         { 
00276             return (int64)to_uint64();
00277         }
00278     int to_int() const
00279         { return (int)to_int64(); }
00280     unsigned int  to_uint() const
00281         { return (unsigned int)to_uint64(); }
00282     long to_long() const
00283         { return (long)to_int64(); }
00284     unsigned long to_ulong() const
00285         { return (unsigned long)to_uint64(); }
00286     double to_double() const
00287         { return value().to_double(); }
00288 
00289     void to_sc_signed( sc_signed& target ) const
00290         { target = value(); }
00291 
00292     void to_sc_unsigned( sc_unsigned& target ) const
00293         { target = value(); }
00294 
00295     // implicit conversions:
00296 
00297     operator  uint64 () const 
00298         { return to_uint64(); }
00299 
00300     operator const sc_unsigned& () const
00301         { return value(); }
00302 
00303     // unary operators:
00304 
00305     sc_unsigned operator + () const
00306         { return value(); } 
00307 
00308     sc_signed operator - () const
00309         { return -value(); } 
00310 
00311     sc_unsigned operator ~ () const
00312         { return ~value(); } 
00313 
00314     // explicit conversion to character string
00315 
00316     const std::string to_string( sc_numrep numrep = SC_DEC ) const
00317         { return value().to_string(numrep); }
00318 
00319     const std::string to_string( sc_numrep numrep, bool w_prefix ) const
00320         { return value().to_string(numrep,w_prefix); }
00321

00324     // assignments
00325 
00326     inline const sc_concatref& operator = ( int v )
00327     {
00328         m_right_p->concat_set((int64)v, 0);
00329         m_left_p->concat_set((int64)v, m_len_r);
00330         return *this;
00331     }
00332 
00333     inline const sc_concatref& operator = ( long v )
00334     {
00335         m_right_p->concat_set((int64)v, 0);
00336         m_left_p->concat_set((int64)v, m_len_r);
00337         return *this;
00338     }
00339 
00340     inline const sc_concatref& operator = ( int64 v )
00341     {
00342         m_right_p->concat_set(v, 0);
00343         m_left_p->concat_set(v, m_len_r);
00344         return *this;
00345     }
00346 
00347     inline const sc_concatref& operator = ( unsigned int v )
00348     {
00349         m_right_p->concat_set((uint64)v, 0);
00350         m_left_p->concat_set((uint64)v, m_len_r);
00351         return *this;
00352     }
00353 
00354     inline const sc_concatref& operator = ( unsigned long v )
00355     {
00356         m_right_p->concat_set((uint64)v, 0);
00357         m_left_p->concat_set((uint64)v, m_len_r);
00358         return *this;
00359     }
00360 
00361     inline const sc_concatref& operator = ( uint64 v )
00362     {
00363         m_right_p->concat_set(v, 0);
00364         m_left_p->concat_set(v, m_len_r);
00365         return *this;
00366     }
00367 
00368     const sc_concatref& operator = ( const sc_concatref& v )
00369     {
00370         sc_unsigned temp(v.length());
00371         temp = v.value();
00372         m_right_p->concat_set(temp, 0);
00373         m_left_p->concat_set(temp, m_len_r);
00374         return *this;
00375     }
00376 
00377     const sc_concatref& operator = ( const sc_signed& v )
00378     {
00379         m_right_p->concat_set(v, 0);
00380         m_left_p->concat_set(v, m_len_r);
00381         return *this;
00382     }
00383 
00384     const sc_concatref& operator = ( const sc_unsigned& v )
00385     {
00386         m_right_p->concat_set(v, 0);
00387         m_left_p->concat_set(v, m_len_r);
00388         return *this;
00389     }
00390 
00391     const sc_concatref& operator = ( const char* v_p )
00392     {
00393         sc_unsigned v(m_len);
00394         v = v_p;
00395         m_right_p->concat_set(v, 0);
00396         m_left_p->concat_set(v, m_len_r);
00397         return *this;
00398     }
00399 
00400     const sc_concatref& operator = ( const sc_bv_base& v )
00401     {
00402         sc_unsigned temp(v.length());
00403         temp = v;
00404         m_right_p->concat_set(temp, 0);
00405         m_left_p->concat_set(temp, m_len_r);
00406         return *this;
00407     }
00408 
00409     const sc_concatref& operator = ( const sc_lv_base& v )
00410     {
00411         sc_unsigned data(v.length());
00412         data = v;
00413         m_right_p->concat_set(data, 0);
00414         m_left_p->concat_set(data, m_len_r);
00415         return *this;
00416     }

00422         { return value().and_reduce(); }
00423 
00424     bool nand_reduce() const
00425         { return value().nand_reduce(); }
00426 
00427     bool or_reduce() const
00428         { return value().or_reduce(); }
00429 
00430     bool nor_reduce() const
00431         { return value().nor_reduce(); }
00432 
00433     bool xor_reduce() const
00434         { return value().xor_reduce(); }

00436     bool xnor_reduce() const
00437         { return value().xnor_reduce(); }
00438 
00439     // other methods
00440 
00441     void print( ::std::ostream& os = ::std::cout ) const
00442         { os << this->value(); }
00443 
00444     void scan( ::std::istream& is ) 
00445     { 
00446         std::string s; 
00447         is >> s; 
00448         *this = s.c_str(); 
00449     } 
00450 
00451 public:
00452     static sc_core::sc_vpool<sc_concatref> m_pool; // Pool of temporary objects.
00453 
00454 public:
00455     enum concat_flags {
00456         cf_none = 0,        // Normal value. 
00457         cf_xz_present = 1   // X and/or Z values present.
00458     };
00459 
00460 protected:
00461     sc_value_base*  m_left_p;    // Left hand operand of concatenation.
00462     sc_value_base*  m_right_p;   // Right hand operand of concatenation.
00463     int             m_len;       // Length of concatenation.
00464     int             m_len_r;     // Length of m_rightt_p.
00465     concat_flags    m_flags;     // Value is read only.
00466 
00467 private:
00468     sc_concatref(const sc_concatref&);
00469     sc_concatref() : m_left_p(0), m_right_p(0), m_len(0), m_len_r(0), m_flags()
00470       {}
00471 };

00519 // SHIFT OPERATORS FOR sc_concatref OBJECT INSTANCES:
00520 //
00521 // Because sc_concatref has implicit casts to both uint64 and sc_unsigned
00522 // it is necessary to disambiguate the use of the shift operators. We do
00523 // this in favor of sc_unsigned so that precision is not lost. To get an
00524 // integer-based result use a cast to uint64 before performing the shift.
00525 
00526 inline const sc_unsigned operator << (const sc_concatref& target, uint64 shift)
00527 {
00528     return target.value() << (int)shift;
00529 }
00530 
00531 inline const sc_unsigned operator << (const sc_concatref& target, int64 shift)
00532 {
00533     return target.value() << (int)shift;
00534 }
00535 
00536 inline const sc_unsigned operator << ( 
00537     const sc_concatref& target, unsigned long shift )
00538 {
00539     return target.value() << (int)shift;
00540 }
00541 
00542 inline const sc_unsigned operator << ( 
00543     const sc_concatref& target, int shift )
00544 {
00545     return target.value() << shift;
00546 }
00547 
00548 inline const sc_unsigned operator << ( 
00549     const sc_concatref& target, unsigned int shift )
00550 {
00551     return target.value() << (int)shift;
00552 }
00553 
00554 inline const sc_unsigned operator << ( const sc_concatref& target, long shift )
00555 {
00556     return target.value() << (int)shift;
00557 }
00558 
00559 inline const sc_unsigned operator >> (const sc_concatref& target, uint64 shift)
00560 {
00561     return target.value() >> (int)shift;
00562 }
00563 
00564 inline const sc_unsigned operator >> (const sc_concatref& target, int64 shift)
00565 {
00566     return target.value() >> (int)shift;
00567 }
00568 
00569 inline const sc_unsigned operator >> ( 
00570     const sc_concatref& target, unsigned long shift )
00571 {
00572     return target.value() >> (int)shift;
00573 }
00574 
00575 inline const sc_unsigned operator >> ( 
00576     const sc_concatref& target, int shift )
00577 {
00578     return target.value() >> shift;
00579 }
00580 
00581 inline const sc_unsigned operator >> ( 
00582     const sc_concatref& target, unsigned int shift )
00583 {
00584     return target.value() >> (int)shift;
00585 }
00586 
00587 inline const sc_unsigned operator >> ( const sc_concatref& target, long shift )
00588 {
00589     return target.value() >> (int)shift;
00590 }
00591 
00592 
00593 // STREAM OPERATORS FOR sc_concatref OBJECT INSTANCES:
00594 
00595 inline
00596 ::std::ostream&
00597 operator << ( ::std::ostream& os, const sc_concatref& v )
00598 { 
00599     return os << v.value();
00600 }
00601 
00602 inline
00603 ::std::istream&
00604 operator >> ( ::std::istream& is, sc_concatref& a )
00605 {
00606     sc_unsigned temp(a.concat_length(0));   
00607     temp.scan( is );
00608     a = temp;
00609     return is;
00610 }
00611 
00612 
00613 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00614 //  CLASS TEMPLATE : sc_concat_bool
00615 //
00616 //  Proxy class for read-only boolean values in concatenations.
00617 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00618 
00619 class SC_API sc_concat_bool : public sc_value_base
00620 {
00621   protected:
00622     static sc_core::sc_vpool<sc_concat_bool> m_pool;  // Temporaries pool.
00623     bool                                     m_value; // Value for this obj.
00624 
00625   public:
00626 
00627     // constructor:
00628     
00629     sc_concat_bool()
00630     : sc_value_base(), m_value()
00631     {}
00632 
00633     // destructor:
00634 
00635     virtual ~sc_concat_bool() 
00636         { }
00637 
00638     // allocation of temporary object:
00639 
00640     static inline sc_concat_bool* allocate( bool v )
00641     {
00642         sc_concat_bool* result_p = m_pool.allocate();
00643         result_p->m_value = v;
00644         return result_p;
00645     }
00646 
00647     // concatenation:
00648 
00649     virtual int concat_length( bool* xz_present_p ) const
00650     { 
00651         if ( xz_present_p ) *xz_present_p = false;
00652         return 1; 
00653     }
00654 
00655     virtual bool concat_get_ctrl( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const
00656     {
00657         int bit = 1 << (low_i % BITS_PER_DIGIT); 
00658         int word_i = low_i / BITS_PER_DIGIT;
00659         dst_p[word_i] &= ~bit;
00660         return false;
00661     }
00662 
00663     virtual bool concat_get_data( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const
00664     {
00665         int bit = 1 << (low_i % BITS_PER_DIGIT); 
00666         int word_i = low_i / BITS_PER_DIGIT;
00667         if ( m_value )
00668             dst_p[word_i] |= bit;
00669         else 
00670             dst_p[word_i] &= ~bit;
00671         return m_value;
00672     }
00673 
00674     virtual uint64 concat_get_uint64() const
00675     {
00676         return m_value ? 1 : 0;
00677     }
00678 };
00679 
00680 
00681 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

00684 
00685 #define SC_CONCAT_OP_TYPE(RESULT,OP,OTHER_TYPE) \
00686     inline RESULT operator OP ( const sc_concatref& a, OTHER_TYPE b ) \
00687     { \
00688         return a.value() OP b; \
00689     } \
00690     inline RESULT operator OP ( OTHER_TYPE a, const sc_concatref& b ) \
00691     { \
00692         return a OP b.value(); \
00693     } 
00694 
00695 
00696 #define SC_CONCAT_OP(RESULT,OP) \
00697     inline RESULT operator OP ( const sc_concatref& a, const sc_concatref& b ) \
00698     { \
00699         return a.value() OP b.value(); \
00700     }  \
00701     SC_CONCAT_OP_TYPE(const sc_signed,OP,int) \
00702     SC_CONCAT_OP_TYPE(const sc_signed,OP,long) \
00703     SC_CONCAT_OP_TYPE(const sc_signed,OP,int64) \
00704     SC_CONCAT_OP_TYPE(RESULT,OP,unsigned int) \
00705     SC_CONCAT_OP_TYPE(RESULT,OP,unsigned long) \
00706     SC_CONCAT_OP_TYPE(RESULT,OP,uint64) \
00707     SC_CONCAT_OP_TYPE(const sc_signed,OP,const sc_int_base&) \
00708     SC_CONCAT_OP_TYPE(RESULT,OP,const sc_uint_base&) \
00709     SC_CONCAT_OP_TYPE(const sc_signed,OP,const sc_signed&) \
00710     SC_CONCAT_OP_TYPE(RESULT,OP,const sc_unsigned&) \
00711     inline RESULT operator OP ( const sc_concatref& a, bool b ) \
00712     { \
00713         return a.value() OP (int)b; \
00714     } \
00715     inline RESULT operator OP ( bool a, const sc_concatref& b ) \
00716     { \
00717         return (int)a OP b.value(); \
00718     } 
00719 
00720 #define SC_CONCAT_BOOL_OP(OP) \
00721     inline bool operator OP ( const sc_concatref& a, const sc_concatref& b ) \
00722     { \
00723         return a.value() OP b.value(); \
00724     }  \
00725     SC_CONCAT_OP_TYPE(bool,OP,int) \
00726     SC_CONCAT_OP_TYPE(bool,OP,long) \
00727     SC_CONCAT_OP_TYPE(bool,OP,int64) \
00728     SC_CONCAT_OP_TYPE(bool,OP,unsigned int) \
00729     SC_CONCAT_OP_TYPE(bool,OP,unsigned long) \
00730     SC_CONCAT_OP_TYPE(bool,OP,uint64) \
00731     SC_CONCAT_OP_TYPE(bool,OP,const sc_int_base&) \
00732     SC_CONCAT_OP_TYPE(bool,OP,const sc_uint_base&) \
00733     SC_CONCAT_OP_TYPE(bool,OP,const sc_signed&) \
00734     SC_CONCAT_OP_TYPE(bool,OP,const sc_unsigned&) \
00735     inline bool operator OP ( const sc_concatref& a, bool b ) \
00736     { \
00737         return a.value() OP (int)b; \
00738     } \
00739     inline bool operator OP ( bool a, const sc_concatref& b ) \
00740     { \
00741         return (int)a OP b.value(); \
00742     }

00763 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00764 // CONCATENATION FUNCTION AND OPERATOR FOR STANDARD SYSTEM C DATA TYPES:
00765 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00766 
00767 inline sc_dt::sc_concatref& concat(
00768     sc_dt::sc_value_base& a, sc_dt::sc_value_base& b)
00769 {
00770     sc_dt::sc_concatref* result_p;     // Proxy for the concatenation.
00771 
00772     result_p = sc_dt::sc_concatref::m_pool.allocate();
00773     result_p->initialize( a, b );
00774     return *result_p;
00775 }
00776 
00777 inline 
00778 const
00779 sc_dt::sc_concatref& concat(
00780     const sc_dt::sc_value_base& a, const sc_dt::sc_value_base& b)
00781 {
00782     sc_dt::sc_concatref* result_p;     // Proxy for the concatenation.
00783 
00784     result_p = sc_dt::sc_concatref::m_pool.allocate();
00785     result_p->initialize( a, b );
00786     return *result_p;
00787 }
00788 
00789 inline 
00790 const
00791 sc_dt::sc_concatref& concat(const sc_dt::sc_value_base& a, bool b)
00792 {
00793     const sc_dt::sc_concat_bool* b_p;        // Proxy for boolean value.
00794     sc_dt::sc_concatref*         result_p;   // Proxy for the concatenation.
00795 
00796     b_p = sc_dt::sc_concat_bool::allocate(b);
00797     result_p = sc_dt::sc_concatref::m_pool.allocate();
00798     result_p->initialize( a, *b_p );
00799     return *result_p;
00800 }
00801 
00802 inline 
00803 const
00804 sc_dt::sc_concatref& concat(bool a, const sc_dt::sc_value_base& b)
00805 {
00806     const sc_dt::sc_concat_bool* a_p;        // Proxy for boolean value.
00807     sc_dt::sc_concatref*         result_p;   // Proxy for the concatenation.
00808 
00809     a_p = sc_dt::sc_concat_bool::allocate(a);
00810     result_p = sc_dt::sc_concatref::m_pool.allocate();
00811     result_p->initialize( *a_p, b );
00812     return *result_p;
00813 }
